function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Large financial aid packages may encourage increased public spending and economic activity, potentially leading to a higher risk of disease transmission in the community.","Impact":"Increased community transmission of contagious diseases, resulting in higher infection rates and strain on healthcare systems.","Mitigation":"Implement strict public health measures and guidelines, including social distancing, mask-wearing, and hygiene protocols, to reduce the risk of disease transmission.","Technologies":"Health monitoring and contact tracing apps, remote health monitoring devices, and AI-based prediction models for disease spread.","People":"General public, government officials, policymakers, healthcare workers, and business owners","Owner":"Government authorities, healthcare organizations, and businesses"},{"Description":"Relaxed budget policies may lead to a lack of financial resources for long-term public health infrastructure and preparedness, creating vulnerability to future disease outbreaks.","Impact":"Inadequate funding for public health infrastructure, surveillance, and response systems, increasing the risk of delayed or ineffective containment measures during future disease outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Allocate specific funds and resources for public health infrastructure and preparedness, prioritize long-term health investments, and ensure robust disease surveillance and response systems.","Technologies":"Digital health platforms, public health surveillance systems, and predictive analytics for disease outbreak detection.","People":"Government authorities, public health officials, and healthcare organizations","Owner":"Government authorities, public health organizations, and international health agencies"},{"Description":"Large-scale financial aid aims to support businesses and affected individuals, but may inadvertently lead to economic disparities, potentially exacerbating social determinants of health and widening health inequities.","Impact":"Increased economic disparities, reduced access to healthcare services, and heightened vulnerability to disease among socioeconomically disadvantaged populations.","Mitigation":"Implement targeted support programs for vulnerable communities, address social determinants of health, and ensure equitable access to healthcare services and resources.","Technologies":"Telemedicine platforms, digital health interventions, and community health outreach tools.","People":"Socioeconomically disadvantaged populations, public health advocates, and policymakers","Owner":"Government authorities, public health organizations, and social welfare agencies"}]}
